Title: Greek debtocracy
Additional_info: Debtocracy seeks the causes of the debt crisis.

Title: Political corruption
Text_English: Areopagitou Korydallos. It's only 2 zeimpekiko turns distance!
Additional_info: Akis Tsochatzopoulos: Former Greek defence minister jailed for 20 years for corruption, released from prison May 4 2017.

Title: Political corruption
Text_English: Aki keep going! Are submarines being effected by heavy sea?!
Additional_info: Akis Tsochatzopoulos: Former Greek defence minister jailed for 20 years for corruption, released from prison May 4 2017.

Title: Powerless citizens
Text_English: The power always gives you the last word!

Title: Two worlds and the crisis
Text_English: Crisis…What else? Against cultural hegemony. Systematic artists

Title: The Greek model of fiscal austerity
The Greek health system
Text_English: No health care system - & Health Kaput
Additional_info: The word kaput (German) is used for things that are broken, useless, or destroyed.

Title: Carnival land
Text_English: National Carnival on your TV sets
Additional_info: The verbal text further refines the picture and contextualizes the sequence.

Title: The apple and the revolution
Text_English: The revolution is not an apple that falls when it is ripe. You have to make it fall

Title: The chronic sleep
Text_English: In 2020? Are you going to wake up?

Title: Migrant crisis
Additional_info: The lyrics of the song Tzivaeri (Domna Samiou) are translated to English by Mariza Koch. The main topic: foreign lands.

Title: The Greek youth
Text_English: We lived our lives; Wrong·  So we changed our pathway (lives).
Additional_info: A verse from the poem “Denial” (Άρνηση) of Greek poet Seferis can be identified, including the musical version of Mikis Theodorakis, on the label that the figure keeps.
Channels_of_circulation: public wall, real object (wooden chair) inside frame

Title: SMEs and Malls
Text_English: They have closed us. The malls are multiplied.

Title: The Greek beggar
Text_English: no..Yes! Spare me for a change!

Title: Political parties
Text_English: All the parties are the same…The same applies to me…

Title: Hymn of Liberty
Text_English: I won’t pay, I won’t pay, hail, liberty, hail
Additional_info: National Anthem of Greece (Solomos 1823), I (We) won’t pay, I (We) won’t pay (Dario Fo mid-1970).

Title: EU Empire
Additional_info: It could be a voice for the women's activist movement against EU.

Title: The tired old man
Additional_info: The physical expression of the space becomes part of the meaning of the picture.

Title: The lost child
Text_English: We are living in a lost generation - nonending adventurous

Title: Subverted praying hands
Name_of_the_creator: Pavlos Tsakonas, Manolis Anastasakos, Kretsis crew
Additional_info: German artist Albrecht Dürer (1508). The work depicts praying hands and was created during collaboration between the Ministry of Environment Energy & Climate Change, and the Athens School of Fine Arts.

Title: Money control
Text_English: From ancient to Modern Times. Who controls money?

Title: Papandreou wedding
Text_English: Georgios Papandreou as a groom after January 26 2015
Additional_info: January 25 2015 Greek legislative election, the coalition of the radical left, syriza, won a legislative election for the first time ever. The pictorial representation represents the former prime minister G. Papandreou, Greek folk song 1970 (Κυρά-Γιώργαινα - Καλατζής Γιάννης & Διαμάντη Λίτσα).

Title: Antifascism
Text_English: I fought the fascists so that my grandchildren could bring them back

Title: The court?
Text_English: I see dead people..But who doesn't?

Title: Greek antiquity
Additional_info: It is referred to the elections on October 4 2009 in Greece. The historical past of classical antiquity with the cultural ideals is reconceptualized and interconnected with the Greek present.

Title: The lady of Athens withouth the head
The sheep and the wolves
Text_English: As long as sheep stand, so wolves will scream

Title: Capitalism!
Text_English: Dear Capitalism, it's not you, it's me. Just kidding, It's you. It's over.

Title: Joking!
Additional_info: Graffiti resulting from the signed series WD, All you need is joke, with the smile inspired of the character of Joker, the enemy of Batman.

Title: Bash it
Additional_info: A critical stance on mass media. During mass demonstrations the protesters criticize mass media such as the television. Television will not be revolutionized or bash it.

Title: Antifascism
Text_English: Kill the fascist you have inside you

Title: Migrant crisis
Additional_info: Inspired by Banksy.

Title: Kill nazism and fascism
Additional_info: Gestalt

Title: NO to the Third Memorandum
Additional_info: Protest of street art against the third Greek bailout program. German nein, as an artistic interference, is written on the EU flag as a background.

Title: Unemployment
Additional_info: It iscinspired by a poster of Alegria (a show by Cirque du Soleil), which had filled Athens’ ad spaces in the past. The represented human figure is the former Greek Prime Minister, Antonis Samaras.

Title: Mass media and revolution
Text_English: The television will not be revolutionized

Title: Financial austerity
Text_English: The time died even if was a doctor

Title: Tanks and Banks
Text_English: Then with tanks, now with banks

Additional_info: The IC XC is a Christogram, a monogram of Jesus’ name.  Jesus Christ in Greek looks like ΙΗΣΟΥΣ ΧΡΙΣΤΟΣ ΙΗΣΟΥΣ stands for Jesus and ΧΡΙΣΤΟΣ stands for Christ.  Greek Prime Minister Tsipras - Jesus Christ.

Title: Money control
Text_English: From ancient to Modern Times. Who controls money?

Title: Priest as hippie
Additional_info: Never Trust a Hippy is an EP by the American punk rock band NOFX, released March 14, 2006 through Fat Wreck Chords.

Title: The smiling woman with the glove
We have the power
Additional_info: It is depicting a child looking up at a huge portrait of the ancient philosopher Democritus. Knowledge is power.
